#Homs: Summary of Events, Thursday, March 29, 2012 Part 1
Homs lives under the bombing and destruction The situation in Homs remains the same, with the continued bombing and fire amid the catastrophic humanitarian conditions and shortage in food and medical supplies. Bread is unavailable, water and electricity are cut Off most of the day, and the migration of residents is continuous from the neighborhoods that are being shelled. Assad forces are still violently bombing the Old Districts of Homs, Khaldiyeh, Bayada, Wadi al-Arab, Bab Tadmur, and Jib al-Jandali using all types of weapons, tanks, mortars, and rockets. Many homes have been destroyed, while others Burned, and many civilians were either killed or injured. Some of the bombing has targeted churches and mosques, some of which are old and historic. Additionally, the market that is in the middle of the city was bombed at night, which resulted in destroying some buildings and Burning others. Â
